comments.author: nicolas.barbulesco@supinfo.com
comments.creator: nicolas.barbulesco@supinfo.com
comments.raw_text:
Here is a little bug I encountered in Firefox 7.0.1 on Mac OS X. I reproduce this bug always.

I have a Firefox window with many tabs. I click on the down triangle to get the local menu listing the tabs. I get it. I press the Down Arrow several times, to go down in this menu. The menu is not displayed entirely. I press the Down Arrow once. This select the next entry, and scrolls a little bit downwards in the menu, but not enough, so I cannot read the selected entry.

Firefox, please scroll a little more downwards, so that I can read the selected entry.

See screen film :
http://screencast.com/t/3jO1QXFvo3NR

Thanks.

Nicolas

I reproduce this bug in Firefox 29 and in Firefox Nightly 32.0a1.

The selected item (in blue) cannot be read.

I reproduce this bug in Firefox 29 and in Firefox Nightly 32.0a1.

comments.text:
Reproduced on current stable on OS X, not on stable/nightly on Archlinux.
Linux build is scrolling by block with the exact height of one tab line, not the OS X build.
